# NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryChange

**Case**

A button that displays its alternate content when clicked and returns to its normal content when the user releases it.

## Declaration

```swift
case momentaryChange
```

## Discussion

When the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/isHighlighted] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the button displays its alternate content (for example, its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/alternateImage] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/alternateTitle]). If the button has no alternate content to display, it may instead draw its normal content using an illuminated effect. When [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/isHighlighted] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the button displays its normal content (for example, its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/image] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSButton/title]).

This option corresponds to the Momentary Change type in Interface Builder’s Attributes inspector.

## Configuring Button Behavior

- **NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryPushIn**: A button that illuminates when the user clicks it.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.momentaryLight**: A button that displays a highlight when the user clicks it and returns to its normal state when the user releases it.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.pushOnPushOff**: A button that switches between on and off states with each click.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.onOff**: A button that switches between a normal and emphasized bezel on each click.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.toggle**: A button that switches between its normal and alternate content on each click.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.switch**: A standard checkbox button.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.radio**: A button that displays a single selected value from group of possible choices.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.accelerator**: A button that sends repeating actions as pressure changes occur.
- **NSButton.ButtonType.multiLevelAccelerator**: A button that allows for a configurable number of stepped pressure levels and provides tactile feedback as the user reaches each step.
